metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9211 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The crypto_skcipher_init_tfm function in crypto/skcipher.c in the Linuxkernel through 4.11.2 relies on a setkey function that lacks a key-sizecheck, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointerdereference) via a crafted application.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9211` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1002.5').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
